other_tests.findings: The findings on repeated lumbar puncture on day 7 were unchanged.
Electromyographic studies showed mild axonal polyneuropathy.
Initial EEGs on days 8 and 10 were nonspecific. On day 14, the EEG showed polymorphic delta activity, consistent with status epilepticus.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progressed into a prolonged and refractory status epilepticus.

other_tests.findings: On day 23, a negative PCR result for West Nile virus in the cerebrospinal fluid was reported for the first time.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Prior to this, PCR test results were positive, with changes in cell count and protein levels across multiple days.
